titles.title: To amend the Uniform Time Act of 1966 to modify the State exemption provisions for advancement of time.
To amend the Uniform Time Act of 1966 to modify the State exemption provisions for advancement of time.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Commerce, Trade and Consumer Protection.

bill.summary:
Amends the Uniform Time Act of 1966 to limit the State exemption from the required advancement of time to daylight savings time with respect to States that have areas lying in more than one time zone.
Terminates the State option to exempt from such advancement one of its time zones alone. Permits such States to exempt only the entire State from daylight savings time advancement.
Declares that this Act shall not apply to any State that, after enactment of this Act but before April 6, 2004, enacts a law exempting the entire area of the State lying within any time zone from the required advancement of time to daylight savings time.
